intro: Saxifraga longifolia subsp. lingulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf saxifrage, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals with a pale pink to white coloration. This subspecies is notable for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
